Wisdom: الْعَالِمُ مَنْ عَرَفَ قَدْرَهُ
enWisdom: The scholar is one who knows his [own] status [and worth]

Wisdom: الْعَالِمُ يَعْرِفُ الْجَاهِلَ لِأَنَّهُ كَانَ قَبْلُ جَاهِلًا
enWisdom: The scholar recognizes the ignorant one because he used to be ignorant [himself] before

Wisdom: الْعَالِمُ كُلُّ الْعَالِمِ مَنْ لَمْ يَمْنَعِ الْعِبَادَ الرَّجَاءَ لِرَحْمَةِ اللَّهِ وَلَمْ يُؤْمِنْهُمْ مَكْرَ اللَّهِ
enWisdom: The scholar who is truly a scholar, is one who does not prevent the servants from having hope in the mercy of Allah and [at the same time] does not give them false security from the scheme of Allah

Wisdom: إِنَّمَا الْعَالِمُ مَنْ دَعَاهُ عِلْمُهُ إِلَى الْوَرَعِ وَالتُّقَى وَالزُّهْدِ فِي عَالَمِ الْفَنَاءِ وَالتَّوَلُّهِ بِجَنَّةِ الْمَأْوَى
enWisdom: Only he is a scholar whose knowledge calls him to piety and God-wariness, to abstinence from the pleasures of the transient world and to infatuation with the heavenly abode

Wisdom: إِذَا كُنْتَ جَاهِلًا فَتَعَلَّمْ وَإِذَا سَأَلْتَ عَمَّا لَا تَعْلَمُ فَقُلْ اللَّهُ وَرَسُولُهُ أَعْلَمُ
enWisdom: If you are ignorant then learn, and when you are asked about that which you do not know then say: Allah and His Prophet know better

Wisdom: بَخْ بَخْ لِعَالِمٍ عَلِمَ فَكَفَّ وَخَافَ الْبَيَاتَ فَأَعَدَّ وَاسْتَعَدَّ إِنْ سُئِلَ أَفْصَحَ وَإِنْ تُرِكَ سَكَتَ كَلَامُهُ صَوَابٌ وَسُكُوتُهُ عَنْ غَيْرِ عِيٍّ عَنِ الْجَوَابِ [فِي الْجَوَابِ‏]
enWisdom: Congratulations to the scholar who knows and thus restrains himself [from sin], and who fears the sudden coming [of death] so he prepares himself and gets readyIf he is questioned he articulates, and if he is left he remains silent; his speech is accurate and his silence is not because of his inability to give an answer

Wisdom: قَوْلُ لَا أَعْلَمُ نِصْفُ الْعِلْمِ
enWisdom: Little knowledge accompanied with action is better than a lot of it without action

Wisdom: وَاضِعُ الْعِلْمِ عِنْدَ غَيْرِ أَهْلِهِ ظَالِمٌ لَهُ
enWisdom: He who places knowledge with one who is unworthy of it has wronged it [or him]

Wisdom: لَا يَسْتَحْيِيَنَّ أَحَدٌ إِذَا سُئِلَ عَمَّا لَا يَعْلَمُ أَنْ يَقُولَ لَا أَعْلَمُ
enWisdom: Indeed, the one who is asked about that which he does not know should never consider it demeaning to say “I don’t know”

Wisdom: لَا تُحَدِّثِ الْجُهَّالَ بِمَا لَا يَعْلَمُونَ فَيُكَذِّبُوكَ بِهِ فَإِنَّ لِعِلْمِكَ عَلَيْكَ حَقّاً وَحَقَّهُ عَلَيْكَ بَذْلُهُ لِمُسْتَحِقِّهِ وَمَنْعُهُ مِنْ غَيْرِ مُسْتَحِقِّهِ
enWisdom: Do not speak to the ignorant ones about that which they do not know such that they belie you, for indeed your knowledge has a right over you and its right is that you bestow it to those who are deserving of it and deny it to those who are not deserving of it

Wisdom: لَا يَزْكُو الْعِلْمُ بِغَيْرِ وَرَعٍ
enWisdom: Knowledge is not purified without piety

Wisdom: لَا يَكُونُ الْعَالِمُ عَالِماً حَتَّى لَا يَحْسُدَ مَنْ فَوْقَهُ وَلَا يَحْتَقِرَ مَنْ دُونَهُ وَلَا يَأْخُذَ عَلَى عِلْمِهِ شَيْئاً مِنْ حُطَامِ الدُّنْيَا
enWisdom: A scholar is not a true scholar until he stops being jealous of one who is above him, does not demean one who is below him and does not take in return for his knowledge anything of the vanities of this world

Wisdom: يَنْبَغِي أَنْ يَكُونَ عِلْمُ الرَّجُلِ زَائِداً عَلَى نُطْقِهِ وَعَقْلُهُ غَالِباً عَلَى لِسَانِهِ
enWisdom: The knowledge of a man should surpass his speech and his intelligence should prevail over his tongue

Wisdom: الْفَقِيهُ كُلُّ الْفَقِيهِ مَنْ لَمْ يُقَنِّطِ النَّاسَ مِنْ رَحْمَةِ اللَّهِ وَلَمْ يُؤْيِسْهُمْ مِنْ رَوْحِ اللَّهِ
enWisdom: The true scholar is one who neither makes people lose hope in the mercy of Allah nor cause them to despair of the comfort of Allah

Wisdom: آفَةُ الْفُقَهَاءِ عَدَمُ الصِّيَانَةِ
enWisdom: The bane of scholars is not safeguarding themselves [from error]

Wisdom: إِذَا تَفَقَّهَ الْوَضِيعُ تَرَفَّعَ
enWisdom: When the vile one becomes a scholar, he considers himself to be above [others]

Wisdom: إِذَا تَفَقَّهَ الرَّفِيعُ تَوَاضَعَ
enWisdom: When the elevated one becomes learned, he shows humility

Wisdom: إِذَا فَقِهْتَ فَتَفَقَّهْ فِي دِينِ اللَّهِ
enWisdom: When you [wish to] learn, then become learned in the religion of Allah

Wisdom: إِذَا أَرَادَ بِعَبْدٍ خَيْراً فَقَّهَهُ فِي الدِّينِ وَأَلْهَمَهُ الْيَقِينَ
enWisdom: When Allah wishes good for a servant, He makes him learned in religion and inspires him with certitude

Wisdom: خَيْرُ الِاجْتِهَادِ مَا قَارَنَهُ التَّوْفِيقُ
enWisdom: The best striving is that which is accompanied by [divinely granted] success

Wisdom: مَنْ تَفَقَّهَ فِي الدِّينِ كَثُرَ
enWisdom: One who becomes learned in religion increases [his prosperity]
